channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Insect populations drop even without direct human interference, a new study finds
item.description: Research published this month found that even in pristine, untouched areas, insect populations are still on the decline. Climate change is a likely cu...

item.title: Something big collapsed this week — again. Do you know what? Take our quiz
item.description: This week, we had news of a drawing that may or may not be the president's, and of a rock that may or may not indicate that Mars had life.

item.title: Why mothers in the U.S. are scaling back on their work lives
item.description: Workforce participation for moms in the U.S. has been dropping for most of this year, and the reasons are more complicated than return-to-office manda...

item.title: Prince Harry makes surprise visit to Ukraine in support of wounded troops
item.description: Britain's Prince Harry has arrived in Ukraine for a surprise visit in support of wounded service members.

item.title: Police share video of Charlie Kirk shooting person of interest. And, prices rise
item.description: Police shared photos and a video of a person fleeing from the scene after Charlie Kirk was fatally shot. Plus, inflation is rising, and the job market...

item.title: Poland rejects Trump's suggestion Russian drone raid a possible mistake
item.description: Responding to President Trump, Poland's leader said, "we would also wish that the drone attack on Poland was a mistake. But it wasn't."

item.title: Supreme Court's upcoming term could be marked by disputes over Trump policies
item.description: Over 300 lawsuits challenging many of Trump's second-term plans have been winding through federal courts, and a handful may be poised for Supreme Cour...

item.title: 9/11: The Daily Report
item.description: Nancy Chen reports on the manhunt to find the person who fatally shot Charlie Kirk, and how the nation is remembering the Sept. 11, 2001, terror attac...

item.title: Choose your America: In the aftermath of the Kirk slaying, a snapshot of a fractured nation
Britain's Prince Harry makes a surprise visit to Ukraine
item.description: Britain's Prince Harry has made a surprise second visit to Ukraine amid Russia's full-scale invasion, lending his support for wounded warriors.

item.title: North Korea executing more people for watching foreign films and TV, UN finds
item.description: The report is based on more than 300 interviews with escapees from Kim Jong Un's secretive regime.

item.title: South Korean workers detained in US raid arrive home
item.description: Media and some protesters gather at the airport as more than 300 workers detained in the US last week return.

item.title: Woman admits killing kids later found in suitcases, prosecutor says
item.description: Police believe Hakyung Lee killed her children a year after her husband's death, and then returned to South Korea.

item.title: South African rapist loses bid to block Netflix film about his life
item.description: Thabo Bester had argued the documentary would affect his trial for allegedly faking his death to escape prison.

item.title: Officials plead for help in finding Charlie Kirk’s shooter
item.description: Federal and state investigators are appealing for the public’s help in finding the person who assassinated conservative activist Charlie Kirk.

item.title: South Sudan vice-president charged with murder and treason
item.description: The roads leading to Riek Machar's house are blocked by tanks and soldiers, amid fears of renewed fighting.

item.title: Ukraine launches 221 drones on Russia, Moscow says
item.description: The overnight attack is the largest since May, but follows much larger bombardments from Russia.

item.title: Assassination of Charlie Kirk adds to America’s roll call of public violence
